greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n)=S, if n belongs to S-sequence described in A240521.
formula: Let n=30. We have a unique representation of 30 as a product of distinct terms of A050376: 30=2*3*5. Consider all terms of A050376 in the interval [2,5]: 2,3,4,5. For terms involving in representation of 30 we correspond 1's, for other terms 0's. After concatenation we obtain the binary number corresponding to 30: 1101.
In decimal it is 13. So a(30)=13. Let now n=60=3*4*5. In interval [3,5] there are all terms of A050376 which corresponds to binary 111. In decimal it is 7. So a(60)=7.
results.author: _Vladimir Shevelev_, Apr 07 2014
ext: Terms corrected and more terms added, _Peter J. C. Moses_, Apr 18 2014
